snippet: Comcast bought the rest of NBCUniversal from General Electric for $16.7 billion; Web sites that help uncover new books, like Goodreads.com, have become indispensable for readers, writers and publishers; and Slacker, a digital music service, takes aim...
abstract: Comcast bought the rest of NBCUniversal from General Electric for $16.7 billion; Web sites that help uncover new books, like Goodreads.com, have become indispensable for readers, writers and publishers; and Slacker, a digital music service, takes aim at Pandora in new advertisements.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Comcast Buys Rest of NBCUniversal, and Sites That Appeal to Book Lovers
